ProjectTitle: A glitch in the matrix: characterization of the potential of ketone bodies to improve muscular and functional adaptations to exercise training in young and older adults
InitialFeedbackHistory: 19/04/2024 [REDACTED] for clinical research and the use of human bodily material you need approval from the UZ [REDACTED] ethical committee instead of PRET, please have a look at the flowchart on https://research.kuleuven.be/en/associatienet/ethics/index and make sure to have approval before you start working with the participants. [REDACTED] you mention no factors restricting data sharing; could privacy, ethics, or IP be a factor restricting sharing? [REDACTED] you do decide to share some of your data e.g. when the journal request this, have a look at RDR where you can apply access restrictions to make the metadata open but only give access to the files upon request: www.kuleuven.be/rdm/en/rdr; or EBI with many options for life sciences: https://www.ebi.ac.uk/submission/
label: good with suggestions
